unrest.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a political situation in which people protest or behave violently
unrest.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: There is growing unrest throughout the country.
The protests were the biggest show of social unrest since the government came to power.
unrest.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: The policy led to rising unemployment and social unrest.
A month of political unrest followed the killing of 12 protesters by the police.
The wave of nation-wide strikes and industrial unrest continued throughout the winter.
Our country is being ripped apart by civil unrest.
Anti-war demonstrations became the focus of student unrest in the early 1970s.
Unemployment and poor housing were significant causes of urban unrest.
Rocketing unemployment led to growing unrest in the country.
We are receiving reports of serious unrest in areas of northern India.
As prices soared, there was widespread unrest.
Troops usually respond to outbreaks of unrest with force.
A wave of unrest had resulted in seven deaths.
The election results were followed by a long period of unrest.
The introduction of new working practices provoked severe industrial unrest.
Food shortages led to widespread social unrest.
Troops were brought in to quell the unrest.
